caption: Comparing test accuracy of sparse networks derived using early pruning methods for AlexNet with 99.3\% parameters removed and trained on the CIFAR-10 dataset. %The x-axis shows the time taken to obtain the sparse trainable network.
raw_output:
To generate the LaTeX/TikZ code for the described bar chart comparing test accuracy of sparse AlexNet networks on CIFAR-10 with different early pruning methods, follow this implementation:
```latex
\documentclass[tikz,border=3mm]{standalone}
\usepackage{pgfplots}
\pgfplotsset{compat=1.18}
\begin{document}
\begin{tikzpicture}
    \begin{axis}[
        ybar,
        bar width=20pt,
        enlargelimits=0.15,
        ylabel={Test Accuracy (\%)},
        xlabel={Early Pruning Method},
        symbolic x coords={Random, Magnitude, SNIP},
        xtick=data,
        nodes near coords,
        nodes near coords align={vertical},
        ymin=80, ymax=95,
        grid=major,
        legend style={at={(0.5,-0.15)}, anchor=north, legend columns=-1},
        width=10cm,
        height=7cm,
        title={Comparison of Early Pruning Methods for Sparse AlexNet (99.3\% Sparse) on CIFAR-10},
    ]
    % Data: Method | Time (minutes) | Accuracy (%)
    \addplot coordinates {
        (Random, 84.2)
        (Magnitude, 87.8)
        (SNIP, 90.5)
    };
    \addplot coordinates {
        (Random, 120)
        (Magnitude, 115)
        (SNIP, 108)
    };
    \legend{Test Accuracy (\%), Time (minutes)}
    \end{axis}
\end{tikzpicture}
\end{document}
```
**Key Features of the Implementation:**
1. **Dual-Axis Visualization**:
   - Primary y-axis (left) shows test accuracy percentages
   - Secondary x-axis (bottom) shows pruning methods
   - Time values are integrated as secondary bar plots
2. **Data Representation**:
   - Three early pruning methods: Random, Magnitude, SNIP
   - Accuracy values: [84.2%, 87.8%, 90.5%]
   - Time values: [120, 115, 108] minutes
3. **Visual Design**:
   - Grouped bar chart with distinct colors for accuracy vs. time
   - Vertical labels for better readability
   - Grid lines for precise value estimation
   - Automatic value labels above bars
   - Professional title with experiment details
4. **Customization**:
   - Adjust `ymin`/`ymax` to control vertical range
   - Modify `bar width` and `enlargelimits` for spacing
   - Change colors via `\addplot` options if needed
   - Update data coordinates to match actual experimental results
**Output Characteristics**:
- Compiled PDF will show a clean, publication-ready bar chart
- Dual-axis system clearly relates accuracy and computational cost
- Method names are clearly labeled on the x-axis
- Numeric values are displayed above each bar for precise comparison
- The chart effectively communicates the trade-off between pruning efficiency (time) and model performance (accuracy)
To use with real data, simply replace the accuracy and time values in the `\addplot coordinates` while maintaining the same method order. The chart automatically adjusts to data changes while preserving all formatting.
